comments.body:
The current version of `natsort` is `5.0.2` released January 27, 2017. Please update the recipe to reflect the most recent version:

https://pypi.python.org/pypi/natsort
I see that `natsort` is available on the `defaults` channel at `5.0.1` and also `4.0.3`. To follow up on my previous comment, is there a reason to not have conda-forge reflect the newest release?
Hi, my problem is that I want to package a software that depends on this particular version.

ok, I'm going to accept this PR, but I'd ask you to update the package once a feedstock for it is made to the latest version. This way you'll have your dependency, but conda-forge won't be out-of-date.
